description: Borrowed from Middle French provocatif, and its source, Late Latin provocativus, from Latin provocare.

adjectives.description: provocative (comparative more provocative, superlative most provocative)

entries.meaning: Serving or tending to elicit a strong, often negative sentiment in another person; exasperating.
Serving or tending to excite, stimulate or arouse sexual interest; sexy.
(obsolete) Something that provokes an appetite, especially a sexual appetite; an aphrodisiac. [from 15th c.]
examples: She used by way of Provocative, to read the wanton Verses of her Paramour in the day time [...].
